pull.title: ci: add unused-using-decls to clang-tidy
pull.body:
Adds https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/misc/unused-using-decls.html to our clang-tidy.
PR'd after the discussion in #25433 (which it includes).

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25308](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25308) (refactor: Reduce number of LoadChainstate parameters and return values by ryanofsky)
* [#24149](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24149) (Signing support for Miniscript Descriptors by darosior)
* [#23319](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23319) (rpc: Return fee and prevout (utxos) to getrawtransaction by dougEfresh)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

- BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE
- nPruneTarget
- OpenBlockFile
- UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE

comments.body: Is there an upstream bug report?

Looks like there is:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/53444
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/55095

Seems like the false-positive may have begun appearing from LLVM 14.0.0. I haven't yet tested if it's fixed in 15.0.0.

Looks like this passes with clang-13:

```
clang-tidy-13 --use-color -p=/bitcoin-core/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu /bitcoin-core/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/miniscript_tests.cpp
651 warnings generated.
1302 warnings generated.
Suppressed 1302 warnings (1302 in non-user code).
Use -header-filter=.* to display errors from all non-system headers. Use -system-headers to display errors from system headers as well.
```

```diff
diff --git a/ci/test/04_install.sh b/ci/test/04_install.sh
index 453a34ca7..064bee2ca 100755
--- a/ci/test/04_install.sh
+++ b/ci/test/04_install.sh
@@ -115,8 +115,8 @@ if [[ "${RUN_TIDY}" == "true" ]]; then
   export DIR_IWYU="${BASE_SCRATCH_DIR}/iwyu"
   if [ ! -d "${DIR_IWYU}" ]; then
     CI_EXEC "mkdir -p ${DIR_IWYU}/build/"
-    CI_EXEC "git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use -b clang_14 ${DIR_IWYU}/include-what-you-use"
-    CI_EXEC "cd ${DIR_IWYU}/build && cmake -G 'Unix Makefiles' -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/usr/lib/llvm-14 ../include-what-you-use"
+    CI_EXEC "git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use -b clang_13 ${DIR_IWYU}/include-what-you-use"
+    CI_EXEC "cd ${DIR_IWYU}/build && cmake -G 'Unix Makefiles' -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/usr/lib/llvm-13 ../include-what-you-use"
     CI_EXEC "cd ${DIR_IWYU}/build && make install $MAKEJOBS"
   fi
 fi
diff --git a/src/test/miniscript_tests.cpp b/src/test/miniscript_tests.cpp
index 1679a5f96..3877fea90 100644
--- a/src/test/miniscript_tests.cpp
+++ b/src/test/miniscript_tests.cpp
@@ -116,7 +116,7 @@ struct KeyConverter {
 //! Singleton instance of KeyConverter.
 const KeyConverter CONVERTER{};
 
-using miniscript::operator"" _mst; // NOLINT(misc-unused-using-decls)
+using miniscript::operator"" _mst;
 
 enum TestMode : int {
     TESTMODE_INVALID = 0,
```

And switch jammy for bookworm, see

https://packages.debian.org/bookworm/clang
or alternatively add a link to the bug report in this line

> or alternatively add a link to the bug report in this line

I'd rather not revert to using LLVM / clang 13, so have added a link to the upstream report.
not sure how that ended up in the wrong commit. fixed now
The issue necessitating the NOLINTNEXTLINE added here is fixed in llvm 16. See https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/55095.
